intro: Pistorinia breviflora subsp. intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate short-flowered pistorinia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its floral structure includes two-lipped corolla with prominent stamens, which are adapted for pollination by insects. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
